text: The 1979 Soviet Cup Final was a football match that took place at the Lenin's Central Stadium, Moscow on 11 August 1979. The match was the 38th soviet cup final and was contested between Dynamo Moscow and Dinamo Tbilisi. Previous cup holders Dynamo Kyiv were eliminated in Quarter-finals by CSKA Moscow. Dinamo Tbilisi defeated the opponent on penalties and won the cup for the second time. == Road to Final== {|width=100% |width=50% valign=top| Dynamo Moscow {| border="2" cellpadding="4" cellspacing="0" style="margin: 1em 1em 1em 0; background: #f9f9f9; border: 1px #aaa solid; border-collapse: collapse; font- size: 95%;" |- |Zone 4||align=right|Dynamo Moscow||2–0||Kairat |- |Zone 4||align=right|Dynamo Moscow||1–0||Shinnik Yaroslavl |- |Zone 4||align=right|Dynamo Moscow||4–0||Kolhozchi |- |Zone 4||align=right|Dynamo Moscow||1–0||Metalist Kharkiv |- |Zone 4||align=right|Dynamo Moscow||3–0||Automobilist Termez |- |Quarter-final||align=right|Dynamo Moscow||3–0||Spartak Moscow |- |Semi-final||align=right|Dynamo Moscow||2–1 aet ||Karpaty Lviv |} |width=50% valign=top| Dinamo Tbilisi {| border="2" cellpadding="4" cellspacing="0" style="margin: 1em 1em 1em 0; background: #f9f9f9; border: 1px #aaa solid; border-collapse: collapse; font-size: 95%;" |- |Zone 1||align=right|Dinamo Tbilisi||2–1||Dynamo Leningrad |- |Zone 1||align=right|Dinamo Tbilisi||5–0||Zorya Voroshilovgrad |- |Zone 1||align=right|Dinamo Tbilisi||2–1||SKA Rostov-on-Don |- |Zone 1||align=right|Dinamo Tbilisi||3–0||Torpedo Kutaisi |- |Zone 1||align=right|Dinamo Tbilisi||2–0||Uralmash |- |Quarter- final||align=right|Dinamo Tbilisi||2–0||Krylia Sovetov |- |Semi- final||align=right|CSKA Moscow||1–2 aet ||Dinamo Tbilisi |} |} == Previous encounters == Previously these two teams met each other eight times in the competition with Dynamo from Moscow being victorious five times and Dinamo from Tbilisi three times. Two of these encounters were cup finals, both won by Dynamo Moscow in 1937 and 1970. ==Match details== {| width="100%" |valign="top" width="50%"| {| style="font-size: 90%" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" |colspan="3"|Dynamo Moscow: |- !width="25"| |- |GK || Nikolai Gontar |- |DF || Evgeny Lovchev |- |DF || Sergei Nikulin |- |DF || Aleksandr Makhovikov (c) |- |DF || Aleksandr Bubnov |- |MF || Aleksei Petrushin |- |MF || Nikolai Kolesov |- |MF || Aleksandr Minayev |- |MF || Nikolai Tolstykh |- |MF || Aleksandr Maksimenkov |- |FW || Valery Gazzaev |- |colspan=3|Substitutes: |- |FW || Vadim Pavlenko |- |colspan=3|Manager: |- |colspan="3"| Viktor Tsaryov |} |valign="top" width="50%"| {| style="font- size: 90%" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" |colspan="3"|Dinamo Tbilisi: |- !width="25"| |- |GK || Otar Gabelia |- |DF || Tengiz Sulakvelidze |- |DF || Aleksandre Chivadze |- |DF || Shota Khinchagashvili |- |DF || David Mujiri |- |MF || Vitaly Daraselia |- |MF || Manuchar Machaidze (c) |- |MF || Vakhtang Koridze |- |MF || Vladimir Gutsaev |- |MF || Gocha Machaidze |- |FW || Ramaz Shengelia |- |colspan=3|Substitutes: |- |FW|| David Kipiani |- |FW|| Nugzar Kakilashvili |- |colspan=3|Manager: |- |colspan="3"| Nodar Akhalkatsi |} |} \---- {| class="wikitable" style="text-align: center; margin: 0 auto;" |- !Soviet Cup 1979 Winners |- |- | Dinamo Tbilisi Second title |} ==See also== * 1979 Soviet Top League ==References== ==External links== * The competition calendar 1 * The competition calendar 2 Category:1979 in Soviet football Category:Soviet Cup finals Category:FC Dynamo Moscow matches Category:FC Dinamo Tbilisi matches Soviet Cup Final 1979 Category:August 1979 sports events in Europe Category:1979 in Moscow
